FuncDef:
The nat log rate command sets a rate at which NAT logs are sent.
The undo nat log rate command restores the default configuration.
By default, NAT logs are sent at a rate of 256,000 logs per second.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the rate at which NAT logs are sent.
The value is an integer ranging from 128 to 1000, in 1000 logs per second. The default value is 256.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the rate at which NAT logs are sent as required, run the nat log rate command.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
